revised_title: Steady-State Heat Conduction Analysis for Two-Terminal Microwave Oscillator Devices with Rectangular Integral Heat Sinks
tldr: The authors present a theoretical analysis to calculate the steady-state temperature distribution within a rectangular prism mounted on a semi-infinite heat sink for two-terminal microwave oscillator devices. They consider the thermal conductivity of the material as temperature-dependent and provide results showing how the maximum temperature rise within heat sink packages depends on the input heat flux and the dimensions and thermal conductivity of the materials.
